text: Guatemala was first at the Olympic Games in 1952. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Guatemala was GUT. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. It is now GUA."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 91 [PDF p. 92 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== Guatemala has been in every Summer Olympic Games since 1968. The nation has been in the Winter Olympic Games only once, in 1988. Guatemala won their first Olympic medal at the 2012 Summer Olympics. Erick Barrondo took second place in the men's 20 km walking race. The National Olympic Committee for Guatemala was formed in 1947 and recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1947. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * Guatemala at Olympic.org * Guatemala profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in Guatemala Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Guatemala
title: Guatemala at the Olympics
